title: China has contingency plans to deal with U.S. trade frictions: state planner
text:
April 18, 2018 / 2:59 AM / Updated 5 hours ago China has contingency plans to deal with U.S. trade frictions: state planner Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
BEIJING (Reuters) - China has various contingency plans and policy reserves to deal with trade frictions started   the country’s top economic planner said on Wednesday. Shipping containers are seen at the port in Shanghai, China April 10, 2018. REUTERS/Aly Song 
The impact from trade frictions between China and the United States on China’s macro economy is limited and manageable, Yan Pengcheng, spokesman for the National Development and Reform Commission, told a news conference. 
Trade tensions have been escalating between the world’s top two economies, leading to worries that Washington and Beijing may engage in a full-scale trade war that could damage global growth and roil markets. Reporting by Stella Qiu, Lusha Zhang and Se Young Lee; Editing by Jacqueline Wong
